title: [Large-scale] Language-based Gamification Training for Construction Site Hazard Identification

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic construction site safety regulations and workflows, and foundational knowledge of safety-related terminology (hazard identification, response protocols, etc.)
context.additional_context: Gamified training in a smartphone-based microlearning environment, targeting the enhancement of hazard identification skills, safety terminology acquisition, and communication proficiency in construction sites.

learning_goals: Learners can identify the top 10 hazards at construction sites with 90% accuracy within three days and clearly explain related safety terminology.
Through gamified simulations, learners select and verbally/textually describe appropriate response procedures within 10 seconds of encountering a hazardous situation.
After training, learners upload at least three risk-identification case studies to a peer assessment system and provide feedback using specialized terminology.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
